name: Extended Exhale Breathing
description: Inhale for 4, exhale for 8 to activate relaxation response.
explanation: Longer exhales stimulate the vagus nerve and parasympathetic nervous system, promoting deep relaxation and stress relief.
when_to_use: Evening wind-down, anxiety relief, or when you need to shift from stress to calm.

round_messages.text: Focus on making your exhale smooth and controlled.
Feel your body releasing tension with each long exhale.

pre_session.text: The key is the long, controlled exhale - twice as long as the inhale.
This technique is excellent for releasing stress and tension.

on_start.text: Begin with natural breathing, then shift to the 4-8 pattern.

on_end.text: Perfect! You've activated your body's natural relaxation response.
This technique is great to use whenever you feel overwhelmed.

cautions: Don't force the exhale - it should be controlled but comfortable.
If 8 seconds feels too long, start with 4-6 and build up gradually.
